long: Meaning: to "tremble" inwardly (or "palpitate"), i.e. (figuratively) "be" (causative, "make") (suddenly) "alarmed" or "agitated"; by implication to "hasten" anxiously.  Usage: be (make) affrighted (afraid, amazed, dismayed, rash), (be, get, make) haste(-n, -y, -ily), (give) speedy(-ily), thrust out, trouble, vex.  Source: a primitive root;
